column1: Further, it was argued by the learned counsel for the respondent that in the instant case the
judicial discretion has been exercised fairly and within the four corners of the applicable statute
by the learned High Court Judge and there is no legal basis to set aside the lawful sentence
imposed by the learned High Court Judge. Therefore, the respondent moves that this Court
affirm the conviction and sentence imposed on the accused-appellants by the High Court of
The learned counsel for the appellants argued that the decision by the learned High Court Judge
to impose long custodial sentences on the appellants was unreasonable and unjustifiable. The
learned counsel for the accused-appellants further requests that the Court can impose a lessor
custodial sentence for all counts based on statutory rape on the following grounds that make
this case a fit and appropriate, to do so;
